page.title: 11PRONY HILL FARM: SUMMER
page.content: In May turnips are sown and grass more than 7 or 8 years old is resown.Ferti- lisers are used to increase yields.At the end of May the sheep go to the hill.The farmer can relax a little in June.But there are still jobs to be done-mending fences,drainage,spraying. In early Jul the fleece of the ewe is clipped. The sheep are gathered and 2 people catch the sheep to be sheared. Another will make a new keel mark and pack fleeces.Jul is also when the hay is made.With modern turners and balers this can be done quickly in good weat- her.Soon after clipping the sheep are dipped to stop flies laying eggs which turn to maggots and can literally eat the sheep.It also controls sheep scab. At the end of Aug the lambs are separ- ated to allow the ewes to get strong before winter.Some lambs are sold in Aug and Sep but most of them go in Oct
